pullrequest.title: qtutils 2.0.0 support and experimental PyQt5 support

content.raw:
Hm. No, don't do that. Leave it as is and I'll pull from you and do the merge locally, as I have verified in another pull request works.

What if you click "edit" on the pull request and then save it with no changes? Does that pull in the new commit?

Bitbucket probably just looks for the head of the branch and ignores closing commits. Silly. Anyway they've indicated they'll fix it soon.
content.html:
Hm. No, don't do that. Leave it as is and I'll pull from you and do the merge locally, as I have verified in another pull request works.

What if you click "edit" on the pull request and then save it with no changes? Does that pull in the new commit?

Bitbucket probably just looks for the head of the branch and ignores closing commits. Silly. Anyway they've indicated they'll fix it soon.
